How do we plan to use this blog? Here are a few ways we know we’ll use it (and I’m...

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Gallery seems to reuse the same instance of MailSender between multiple threads" (#5816) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/67373eb24d14207969ecb80f0c9c20a8cc17f7fd/src/NuGetGallery/App_Start/DefaultDependenciesModule.cs#L268-L309

Here we create a `Lazy<IMailSender>` object (one per process) and pass `c => mailSenderThunk.Value` as a factory for generating `InstancePerLifetimeScope` objects. `mailSenderThunk.Value` on first evaluation will run the big chunk of code that creates `MailSender` and subsequent calls will reuse the instance it created.
This should only be done if we are sure that `MailSender` is thread-safe.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Certificates:  add migration for certificate registration" (#5814) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Progress on https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/5634.

CC @skofman1 

@joelverhagen, here's the SQL:
```
CREATE TABLE [dbo].[UserCertificates] (
    [Key] [int] NOT NULL IDENTITY,
    [CertificateKey] [int] NOT NULL,
    [UserKey] [int] NOT NULL,
    [IsActive] [bit] NOT NULL,
    CONSTRAINT [PK_dbo.UserCertificates] PRIMARY KEY ([Key])
)
CREATE INDEX [IX_CertificateKey] ON [dbo].[UserCertificates]([CertificateKey])
CREATE INDEX [IX_UserKey] ON [dbo].[UserCertificates]([UserKey])
CREATE TABLE [dbo].[PackageRegistrationRequiredSigners] (
    [PackageRegistrationKey] [int] NOT NULL,
    [UserKey] [int] NOT NULL,
    CONSTRAINT [PK_dbo.PackageRegistrationRequiredSigners] PRIMARY KEY ([PackageRegistrationKey], [UserKey])
)
CREATE INDEX [IX_PackageRegistrationKey] ON [dbo].[PackageRegistrationRequiredSigners]([PackageRegistrationKey])
CREATE INDEX [IX_UserKey] ON [dbo].[PackageRegistrationRequiredSigners]([UserKey])
ALTER TABLE [dbo].[Certificates] ADD [Sha1Thumbprint] [varchar](40)
ALTER TABLE [dbo].[Packages] ADD [CertificateKey] [int]
CREATE INDEX [IX_CertificateKey] ON [dbo].[Packages]([CertificateKey])
ALTER TABLE [dbo].[Packages] ADD CONSTRAINT [FK_dbo.Packages_dbo.Certificates_CertificateKey] FOREIGN KEY ([CertificateKey]) REFERENCES [dbo].[Certificates] ([Key])
ALTER TABLE [dbo].[UserCertificates] ADD CONSTRAINT [FK_dbo.UserCertificates_dbo.Users_UserKey] FOREIGN KEY ([UserKey]) REFERENCES [dbo].[Users] ([Key]) ON DELETE CASCADE
ALTER TABLE [dbo].[UserCertificates] ADD CONSTRAINT [FK_dbo.UserCertificates_dbo.Certificates_CertificateKey] FOREIGN KEY ([CertificateKey]) REFERENCES [dbo].[Certificates] ([Key]) ON DELETE CASCADE
ALTER TABLE [dbo].[PackageRegistrationRequiredSigners] ADD CONSTRAINT [FK_dbo.PackageRegistrationRequiredSigners_dbo.PackageRegistrations_PackageRegistrationKey] FOREIGN KEY ([PackageRegistrationKey]) REFERENCES [dbo].[PackageRegistrations] ([Key]) ON DELETE CASCADE
ALTER TABLE [dbo].[PackageRegistrationRequiredSigners] ADD CONSTRAINT [FK_dbo.PackageRegistrationRequiredSigners_dbo.Users_UserKey] FOREIGN KEY ([UserKey]) REFERENCES [dbo].[Users] ([Key]) ON DELETE CASCADE
INSERT [dbo].[__MigrationHistory]([MigrationId], [ContextKey], [Model], [ProductVersion])
VALUES (N'201804171613337_AddCertificateRegistration', N'NuGetGallery.Migrations.MigrationsConfiguration',   , N'6.1.3-40302')
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Organizations - member add should be able to lookup via email address, not just nuget.org username" (#5815) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Adding members to the NuGet organization, I had difficulty adding my team members.

I didn't know many of their NuGet usernames.
I did know all of their email addresses.

Since they had AAD joined their usernames, this would have been much more usable for me if I could just type in their email address. Then nuget.org would find the appropriate username.

(That said, even more awesome, would be if I could point NuGet towards a security group in AAD, and if it would automatically make members of that contributors.)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Login Discontinuation Configuration should be case-insensitive" (#5686) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: The configuration lists are not case-insensitive, which has led to some odd behavior with certain users. It should be case-insensitive.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Organizations] Telemetry for organizations" (#5711) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
- event for organization transform initiated, cancelled, rejected, completed (contain whether or not org has AAD restriction, include unique id e.g. key in org table)
- event for organization creation (contain whether or not org has AAD restriction, include unique id e.g. key in org table)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Organizations] Implement Organizations feature flag in Login Discontinuation Configuration" (#5769) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Closed issue "[Organizations] Show warning to users who are about to transform their account" (#5690) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Users should be given a better warning that transforming their account into an organization. Transforming a user into an organization is a one-way operation that could leave the user in an undesired state.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Revert #5811" (#5813) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
This reverts commit bdcf7f50ca56fd3d60b3ab29178132a4d2e24883.

@skofman1 suggested that instead of storing required signer on PackageRegistration entity, that it be stored in a separate table to future proof against the possibility of multiple required signers in the future.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Organizations] Organization collaborators should have same permissions on packages as administrators" (#5731) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Discussing offline with @skofman1, we should allow collaborators to upload new package IDs and contact support, but not manage package ownership.

(check API key creation flow to make sure it uses permissions service)

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "add more data point for error/warning" (#6786) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "Untrusted signature timestamper CAs are no longer rejected by verify" (#6842) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I updated client bits.

Old version: 4.7.0-preview4.5067
New version: 4.7.0-preview6.5106

I noticed a change in behavior in the case when the signing certificate is trusted but the timestamper certificate is untrusted. Is this expected?

Here is a repro with the package, the primary signature root CA cert (which should be added to the trusted store) and the two versions of NuGet.exe: [Repro.zip](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/1921900/Repro.zip)

I would like to reject timestamps that are untrusted. It is no longer clear to me how to do this with client code.

**Old behavior: error** 

```
Verifying TestSigned.leaf-1.1.0.0
C:\Users\jver\Desktop\.\TestSigned.leaf-1.1.0.0.nupkg

Signature Hash Algorithm: SHA256
Timestamp: 4/17/2018 3:30:01 PM

Verifying timestamp with timestamping service certificate:
  Subject Name: CN=NuGet Test Timestamp Service (e2de2a26-fed4-419e-873d-e1bba2232a4a), O=NuGet, L=Redmond, S=WA, C=US
  SHA1 hash: E39708F60641CF798ABBD277D9EB60A7851CBB8A
  SHA256 hash: F392A2FA525ED0283D35391230CC9A17263EF0B2EC6CB64483A5531DB074FC87
  Issued by: CN=NuGet Test Root Certificate Authority (dc31bfcc-d036-4cef-9fe3-cba329425578), O=NuGet, L=Redmond, S=WA, C=US
  Valid from: 4/17/2018 3:29:55 PM to 4/17/2018 5:29:55 PM

NU3028: A certificate chain processed, but terminated in a root certificate which is not trusted by the trust provider.
WARNING: NU3028: The revocation function was unable to check revocation because the revocation server was offline.
WARNING: NU3028: The revocation function was unable to check revocation for the certificate.
Finished with 1 errors and 2 warnings.

Package signature validation failed.
```

**New behavior: no error about trust, successful verification**

```
Verifying TestSigned.leaf-1.1.0.0
C:\Users\jver\Desktop\.\TestSigned.leaf-1.1.0.0.nupkg

Signature Hash Algorithm: SHA256
Signature type: Author
Verifying the author primary signature with certificate:
  Subject Name: CN=NuGet Test $Signing Certificate (46ed58bc-fb87-4a2d-9493-e73bdd917c6d), O=NuGet, L=Redmond, S=WA, C=US
  SHA1 hash: 2F4E0901657E0D3EB51E1FE9AF5178585E35F186
  SHA256 hash: FDF111C44FD1A66B80C5C228BC572312AD4B9584AD8BF28A6FD354A01A95778A
  Issued by: CN=NuGet Test Intermediate Certificate Authority (0f46f0cf-7e5d-4478-a110-e3a759b8725a), O=NuGet, L=Redmond, S=WA, C=US
  Valid from: 4/17/2018 3:29:50 PM to 4/17/2018 3:40:00 PM

WARNING: NU3018: The author primary signature found a chain building issue: The revocation function was unable to check revocation because the revocation server was offline.
WARNING: NU3018: The author primary signature found a chain building issue: The revocation function was unable to check revocation for the certificate.
Timestamp: 4/17/2018 3:30:01 PM

Verifying author primary signature's timestamp with timestamping service certificate:
  Subject Name: CN=NuGet Test Timestamp Service (e2de2a26-fed4-419e-873d-e1bba2232a4a), O=NuGet, L=Redmond, S=WA, C=US
  SHA1 hash: E39708F60641CF798ABBD277D9EB60A7851CBB8A
  SHA256 hash: F392A2FA525ED0283D35391230CC9A17263EF0B2EC6CB64483A5531DB074FC87
  Issued by: CN=NuGet Test Root Certificate Authority (dc31bfcc-d036-4cef-9fe3-cba329425578), O=NuGet, L=Redmond, S=WA, C=US
  Valid from: 4/17/2018 3:29:55 PM to 4/17/2018 5:29:55 PM

WARNING: NU3028: The author primary signature's timestamp found a chain building issue: The revocation function was unable to check revocation because the revocation server was offline.
WARNING: NU3028: The author primary signature's timestamp found a chain building issue: The revocation function was unable to check revocation for the certificate.
Finished with 0 errors and 4 warnings.

Successfully verified package 'TestSigned.leaf-1.1.0.0'.
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "View in Object browser does not work Nuget Packages" (#6820) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
There are couple issues regarding dependencies brought by Nuget packages and "View in Object Browser" command in .Net core projects

1) I can right click on a nuget package dependency and choose View in Object browser but nothing happens. (Object browser window doesn't even come up)

2) When I expand nuget reference and right click on a reference dll, there is no object browser command.

The only way is to open object browser manually and navigate to type I want to check.

_This issue has been moved from https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/230689/view-in-object-browser-does-not-work-nuget-package.html

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Migrator dialog title shows a {0}" (#6832) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe): VS UI

VS version (if appropriate): 15.7 preview 4

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Launch VS and create new net framework project. (packages.config)
2. Install jquery v3.3.1 and Newtonsoft.Json v6.0.4
3. Right click on packages.config and select "Migrate packages.config to PackageReference"
4. Click "Ok"
...

## Expected
The dialog title should be correctly formatted.

## Actual
The dialog shows "Migrate NuGet format to PackageReference - {0}"

![miagrate dialog title](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2132567/38759908-12c0c430-3f2d-11e8-8bb4-0dd25d7c580d.PNG)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Accessibility] Package compatibility issues in migrator are not narrated" (#6831) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe): VS UI

VS version (if appropriate): 15.7 preview 4

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Open JAWS to start narrating screen.
2. Launch VS and create new net framework project. (packages.config)
3. Install jquery v3.3.1 and Newtonsoft.Json v6.0.4
4. Right click on packages.config and select "Migrate packages.config to PackageReference"

...

## Expected
The list of issues inside "Package compatibility issues" for each package should be narrated, and the user should be able to navigate the list of issues with the keyboard.

## Actual
JAWS only narrates the names of each package and lets you open or close the list, but there is no way to go to each issue with the keyboard, you can only move between package names.

![package compatibility issues](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2132567/38759872-de21870a-3f2c-11e8-84de-44941a6b32f2.PNG)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Add E2E coverage to packages with countersignatures" (#6808) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: There's no Apex or E2E tests that cover scenarios with repository countersigned packages.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Memory is invalid while updating signer info when adding timestamp to countersignature" (#6840) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
When adding a timestamp to a countersignature there are a couple of steps that are followed:

1. Get the unsigned attribute for the countersignature
2. Decode a signerInfo for the countersignature from the unsigned attribute
3. Remove countersignature unsigned attribute
4. Update the signerInfo with a new unsigned attribute
5. Encode the signerInfo back to an unsigned attribute
6. Add unsigned attribute back to signature

Sometimes, when encoding the updated signer info to add it back to the signature the operation fails because the object is invalid. This is not consistent every time a timestamp is added to a countersignature.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Error occurred while restoring NuGet packages: Library not registered. (Exception from HRESULT: 0x8002801D (TYPE_E_LIBNOTREGISTERED))" (#6841) at NuGet/Home

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)): Win10

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Open \\vwdbuild01\Temp\antonpis\repro\NestingTestSolution.zip solution on the build i specified or newer.

2. See error after restore: Error occurred while restoring NuGet packages: Library not registered. (Exception from HRESULT: 0x8002801D (TYPE_E_LIBNOTREGISTERED))

### Verbose Logs

Please include verbose logs (NuGet.exe <COMMAND> -verbosity detailed | dotnet.exe <COMMAND> --verbosity diag | etc...)

### Sample Project

Very helpful if you can zip a project and paste into this issue!

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Repository Signatures" (#6378) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Status: **Reviewing**

Use this issue to discuss the [Repository Signatures](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/wiki/Repository-Signatures) spec.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "PackageBuilder compatibility issues" (#6838) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
In older versions of NuGet (e.g. 2.X), the `PackageBuilder.WriteManifest()` method supported unicode package IDs by escaping them if needed, e.g. for a package with id `告`, the .nuspec file would be named `%E5%91%8A.nuspec` instead of `告.nuspec`.

In newer versions (e.g. 4.5), the package name is used as-is. 

This causes problem when creating a package with 4.5 and trying to use it with something that expects the old behavior (e.g. an older version of the NuGet server).

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Memory is invalid while updating signer info when adding timestamp to countersignature" (#6840) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
When adding a timestamp to a countersignature there are a couple of steps that are followed:

1. Get the unsigned attribute for the countersignature
2. Decode a signerInfo for the countersignature from the unsigned attribute
3. Remove countersignature unsigned attribute
4. Update the signerInfo with a new unsigned attribute
5. Encode the signerInfo back to an unsigned attribute
6. Add unsigned attribute back to signature

Sometimes, when encoding the updated signer info to add it back to the signature the operation fails because the object is invalid. This is not consistent every time a timestamp is added to a countersignature.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NuGet CLI "pack" should re-evaluate project versions to allow git versioning" (#6839) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I'm running into the same issue reported in [#4790](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/4790).
Essentially, I have two projects in the same solution (A and B).  B references A.  Both have nuspec files, and both are using GitVersionTask to generate a SemVer.

When I use Nuget to pack project B, using includereferencedprojects, A shows as a dependency in the output package for B, but is using 1.0.0, instead of the generated version number.

Base on the history from #4790, this issue may have been fixed for the new csproj and msbuild /t: pack, but I am still running into this situation with the traditional packages.config, and traditional .NET Class Library project.

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe)

NuGet version (4.6.2.5055):

VS version (if appropriate): 15.6.6 (VS 2017 Pro)

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)): win10 v1709

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Create two .NET Framework (legacy csproj) libraries: A and B with a common solution directory.
2. Add the solution to git source control and commit.
3. Add reference from B to A
4. Install GitVersionTask package to both
5. Commit all changes to git.
6. Run a package restore on the solution and pack both projects.

I've tried the workaround from #4790, but it does not seem to have any affect when using nuget cli and packages.config.

Any help/suggestions would be greatly appreciated.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Deprecation of www.nuget.org/nuget.exe" (#20) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
|Spec wiki|Discussion issue|
|----------|------------------|
|*None*|https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/5381|

We are deprecating the use of URL: **www.nuget.org/nuget.exe** which currently downloads nuget.exe version 2.8.6. If you have a dependency on this URL, we recommend you to start using **https://dist.nuget.org/win-x86-commandline/v2.8.6/nuget.exe**. 

For consistency, we are also changing this endpoint to redirect to dist.nuget.org, which is our primary home for downloading all released versions of nuget.exe. 

**Old redirect:** https://az320820.vo.msecnd.net/downloads/nuget.exe 
**New redirect:** https://dist.nuget.org/win-x86-commandline/v2.8.6/nuget.exe

If you are interested in downloading newer versions of nuget.exe, please see the [Downloads](https://www.nuget.org/downloads) page on nuget.org.

For other methods of installing our client tools, please see our [Installing NuGet client tool](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/install-nuget-client-tools) documentation.

**Note:** There is no immediate plan to remove the URL **www.nuget.org/nuget.exe** . We will monitor the usage before taking it offline. We will also reach out again before taking the URL offline.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NuGet Package Debugging & Symbols Improvements" (#19) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
The **NuGet Package Debugging & Symbols Improvements** spec is now ready for **review**:
